channel.title: Jq on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Jq on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: using "jq" for command line web applications for civic data
item.description: One of the tools that I rediscovered and have been really happy for having done so is “jq”, a command line tool that bills itself as “awk for json”. I’ve been writing awk code since 1985, and some limited subset of it is something that I know really, really well. awk, however, is from the punchcard era, and as such it likes to deal with records that are all on one line each.
